title: Which ink should I buy? Montblanc or Visconti? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can buy any ink you like - most inks are well behaved except inks like Noodler’s Bay State Blue (Stains almost anything and does not mix well with other inks) or shimmer inks from Diamine or J Herbin etc which have shimmer particles that tend to clog the feed over a period of time or Iron Gall Inks (which have become a lot better in recent times). Montblanc and Visconti inks are extremely color limited. Please consider Iroshizuku, Diamine, J Herbin, Noodler’s and other brands for a wide variety of inks. PS : Do consider Montblanc’s warranty condition which forces one to use their inks.

Why is the bottle important? Surely the quality and colour range of the ink  as well as the price is more important? Look at Diamine inks - try them out - they are about $5 for 80ml (at least in the UK) and they are some of the best inks available in the world unless a fancy bottle is more important to you. Diamine Inks - Fountain pen inks  They have 100 standard colours and they don't clog pens in my experience. The biggest difference is that you are not paying a price premium for a big brand name and a fancy bottle when it's the ink that's really the important element. In my humble opinion at least.   i sell these inks as a sideline to my pen making business and have never had a complaint but I have no other commercial link to Diamine Inks other than Ive found them to be top quality and I use them personally every day
